title.narrative: Assistance with agricultural inputs to Tropical Storm Amanda and Cristóbal-affected families to ensure the protection and rapid restoration of livelihoods

description.narrative: The main objective of this project is to reduce the deterioration of food security in the face of tropical storms Amanda and Cristóbal, in the context of the COVID-19 emergency in El Salvador. FAO will use CERF funds to deliver seeds, fertilizers and supplies to 2,800 families to restore food production. 14,000 people in affected communities will benefit from this project, which will be implemented within 4 months.

participating-org.narrative: Food and Agriculture Organization of the United Nations (FAO)

owner-org.narrative: UN OCHA Central Emergency Response Fund (CERF)

organisation.narrative: UN Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs (OCHA)

mailing-address.narrative: United Nations Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs (OCHA), Central Emergency Response Fund (CERF), 2 United Nations Plaza (DC2), East 44th street (13th floor), United Nations, New York, USA

description.narrative: Disbursement to CERF Project Assistance with agricultural inputs to Tropical Storm Amanda and Cristóbal-affected families to ensure the protection and rapid restoration of livelihoods

receiver-org.narrative: Food and Agriculture Organization of the United Nations (FAO)

title.narrative: RESIDENT / HUMANITARIAN COORDINATOR REPORT ON THE USE OF CERF FUNDS EL SALVADOR RAPID RESPONSE STORM (HURRICANE, CYCLONE, ETC.) 2020

condition.narrative: CERF funding is based on an agreed proposal, including specific planned outcomes and outputs.

description.narrative: The agricultural production of 2,800 vulnerable households has been protected and reactivated through access to seeds and fertilizers.
Number of households that have received agricultural inputs (seeds and fertilizers).
